subject: AI
title: ReAct Framework
description: Combine reasoning with real actions in a single loop.

hook.text: The model reasons beautifully but can't check facts. You want it to think, then search the web, then think again based on what it found.

buildup.text: ReAct (Reasoning + Acting) interleaves thought steps with tool calls. Think â†’ Act (search, calculate, look up) â†’ Observe the result â†’ Think again.

discovery.text: 'I need to find the GDP of France. Action: search("France GDP 2024"). Observation: $3.1T. Thought: Now I can compare it to Germany'sâ€¦' The model's reasoning stays grounded in real data.

twist.text: Without the Act step, the model hallucinates facts. Without the Think step, the model uses tools randomly. You need both reasoning and action together.

climax.text: ReAct is the backbone of most AI agent architectures. If your task needs external information or real-world actions, this is the pattern to learn.

punchline.text: Think, act, observe, repeat. The simplest agent loop that actually works.

quiz.question: What does the ReAct framework combine?
options: Reasoning steps with real-world tool actions
